According to a WikiLeak( ed) US diplomatic cable, titled` Presidential Succession in Egypt', dated May 14, 2007: Egyptian intelligence chief and Hosni Mubarak consigliere, in past years Soliman was often cited as likely to be named to the long-vacant vice-presidential post. In the past two years, Soliman has stepped out of the shadows, and allowed himself to be photographed, and his meetings with foreign leaders reported. Many of our contacts believe that Soliman, because of his military background, would at least have to figure in any succession scenario. From 1993 until Saturday, Omar Suleiman was chief of Egypt's Colin Powell Intelligence Service. comes from Silicon Alley Insider:`` This is not a loss for Google,'' notes Jay Yarow.`` Increasingly, it has seemed like Eric Schmidt was just an ambassador'' for the company. Our read of the company is that Sergey Brin and Page have been driving most of the major strategic decisions for a while, says Yarow. So what brought the move about? It's probably`` because Sergey Brin and Larry were frustrated with dealing with him. Note the quote from Eric Schmidt that Google wanted to` speed up decision making.
